full_summary:
# Professional Services—Interpretation

**Reference Number:** PW-__ZF-519-41173

**Amendment Number:** 2

**Publication Date:** 2022-10-18

**Tender Closing Date:** 2022-11-18T14:00:00

**Amendment Date:** 2022-11-08

**Expected Contract Start Date:** None

**Expected Contract End Date:** None

**Tender Status:** Expired

## Description

The Translation Bureau of Public Works and Government Services Canada requires an Invitation to Stand Offer (RFSO) for sign language interpretation services.

This procurement aims to acquire the necessary services to meet the Translation Bureau's requirements for parliamentary, conference, and major government events.

## Requirements

### Period of Contract

The period during which Service Orders against the Standing Offer may be placed will be 2 years from the date of issuance of the Standing Offer, with an option to extend the contract for 3 additional years.

### Pedagogical and Isolation Techniques

The Translation Bureau seeks industry input on the following topics:

1. Draft statement of work
2. Proposed pricing model
3. Questions for industry
4. Definition and Acronyms
5. Ideas related to the proposed market
6. Industry interest and readiness
7. Understanding the impacts on the industry

### Delivery Date

The contract is expected to be completed on a set timeline, as outlined by the Translation Bureau.

## Contact

* Name: Morctar Fall
* E-mail: [moctar.fall@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:moctar.fall@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* Phone: (613) 858-7801
* Address: Lafleur Building, 95 Metcalfe Street, Room 408, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5

## Attachment

The attachment details can be found in the [Canadabuy](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/10/17/73e6a92f034b39ac6245749224aff92b/ABES.PROD.PW__ZF.B519.E41173.EBSU000.PDF) website.

## Prohibition Ruling

The Translation Bureau retains the right to engage in negotiations with prospective bidders at any stage during the procurement process.

## Countries and Languages of Interpretation

Languages of interpretation include English and French
